image.altText: Prabhjeet Gill wears a turban and has a beard

props.synopsis: A student paramedic who accused Ambulance Victoria of discrimination on the grounds of race and religion is "ecstatic" to have won his battle to allow cultural beards on the job.

title.children: Student paramedic wins battle with Ambulance Victoria over beard policy

image.altText: An image of a man clad in black throwing an object.

props.synopsis: Two men have been charged with assaulting police at a rally in Melbourne's CBD in October. The arrests come as police prepare for another demonstration in the city on Sunday.

title.children: More arrests over protest violence as police prepare for another Melbourne rally

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt and glasses standing at a train station holding a free travel voucher

props.synopsis: A promised month of free travel on the Gippsland Line in Victoria's east prompts complaints from some passengers, with even a V/Line staff member unsure of how the system works.

title.children: Victorian free travel scheme sparks confusion as commuters report mixed messages

image.altText: A pile of cherries in a marketplace stall.

props.synopsis: The latest casualty in a year of delayed crops is the cherry, with cold weather in some growing regions setting the festive favourite "weeks" behind schedule.

title.children: Cherry season 'weeks' behind schedule as cold blasts put crops on ice

image.altText: A man in scrubs, smiling in a grain field with a dog

props.synopsis: A north-west Victorian pharmacist is being celebrated for his contribution to his local community after winning an award for going the "extra mile".

title.children: Regional pharmacist wins award for dedication to patients and community

image.altText: A curved wall in a gallery with a selection of artwork on it

props.synopsis: A new exhibition in the Victorian city of Ballarat aims to raise awareness about gender-based violence through works contributed by victim-survivors.

title.children: Victorian exhibition raises awareness about gender-based violence

image.altText: Parish of St Peter's in Ballarat

props.synopsis: An Anglican bishop says regional dioceses around Australia are facing financial pressure and potential closure due to having to pay millions of dollars to abuse victim-survivors.

title.children: Anglican Diocese of Ballarat under financial strain from abuse payouts

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: An eight-year-old boy has been treated for non-life-threatening injuries after a reported stabbing at a school in Melbourne's south-east on Thursday morning, police say.

title.children: Eight-year-old boy injured in reported stabbing at Melbourne school

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Police say a search of an area of state park near Ballarat for missing woman Samantha Murphy may continue beyond Thursday.

title.children: State park search for Samantha Murphy could continue beyond Thursday

image.altText: A man wearing a hard hat.

props.synopsis: The operators of Ballarat Gold Mine have been charged over a rockfall that killed 37-year-old miner Kurt Hourigan and seriously injured a 21-year-old workmate in March 2024.

title.children: Ballarat mine operators charged over fatal rockfall

image.altText: A man wearing a red polo shirt sits at a desk holding paperwork next to a person wearing a blue checkered shirt.

props.synopsis: ASIC alleges businessman David McWilliams has continued to spend money in frozen bank accounts on cruises, gambling and a trip to Disneyland.

title.children: ASIC takes action over Gold Coast developer's alleged spending

image.altText: The view from the top of wind turbine over a field with other wind turbines in the background

props.synopsis: A second renewable energy provider says it is taking "immediate action" after the discovery of asbestos in imported brake pads used on access lifts at its wind farms around the country.

title.children: Second company confirms asbestos in imported wind turbine lift brake pads

image.altText: A Victorian firefighter works to back-burn and put out hotspots

props.synopsis: Dry conditions dogging Victoria put the state at a high risk of bushfires this summer, according to the latest summer fire outlook.

title.children: Summer fire outlook puts Victoria at high bushfire risk

image.altText: mick costa hero

props.synopsis: Jujubes are a relatively unknown fruit for most Australians, but the sweet fruit has strong domestic demand for those looking for a taste of home.

title.children: Victorian grower finds success in relatively unknown sweet crop

image.altText: Sydney University buildings on a sunny day

props.synopsis: Australia's top universities have aligned themselves with oil and gas producers, miners and developers on a a key piece of environment legislation, drawing the ire of dozens of academics.

title.children: Australia's top universities seek changes to key environmental reform

image.altText: Teacher and footballer Ash Riddell looks straight on at the camera, with her students behind

props.synopsis: Roos star — and grade 6 teacher — Ash Riddell has an entire school behind her ahead of this Saturday's AFLW grand final.

title.children: Why a second job is a joy for Ash Riddell in the lead-up to grand final

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: More than 14,000 Optus services south-east of Melbourne were affected by the Wednesday morning outage, which the telco says was caused by vandals attempting to steal copper.

title.children: Optus blames 'significant' Melbourne outage on vandalism

image.altText: A young, dark-haired boy in a bushy area.

props.synopsis: The grieving parents of a four-year-old boy who drowned in a suburban lagoon are suing Melbourne Water and a council over the tragedy.

title.children: Parents of drowned boy sue over 'inadequate' fence

image.altText: A map of Melbourne's CBD with a region highlighted roughly from Docklands, to the MCG, and Carlton to Southbank.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's CBD will become a designated area from this weekend for six months, giving police the power to search people and vehicles for prohibited weapons without a warrant.

title.children: Police search powers in Melbourne CBD criticised as 'gross invasion'

image.altText: A headshot of a smiling woman with stringy brown hair framing her face.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne court hears accused attacker Lauren Darul has previously had 16 warrants out for her arrest for failing to appear on bail.

title.children: Woman accused of 'broad daylight' Melbourne CBD stabbing refused bail

image.altText: Jennifer is smiling, has arms wrapped around Paul, who is looking at her. They are at the beach.

props.synopsis: Court documents allege the hospital breached its duty of care while caring for Port Fairy woman Jennifer Buchanan.

title.children: Family sues Geelong Hospital over alleged medical negligence

image.altText: A house on fire.

props.synopsis: Police believe arsonists targeted a home in Melbourne's inner west overnight, forcing a family to flee the property.

title.children: Police believe Melbourne house fire was targeted attack

image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: The 66-year-old accused of killing two Melbourne in 1977 will stand trial over the murders, but has had a rape charge dismissed.

title.children: Perry Kouroumblis to stand trial over Easey Street murders

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man engaged in "deceptive" conduct when he raped a woman during a house party and tried to cover it up, prosecutors say.

title.children: Melbourne man faked evidence to cover up house party rape, court told

image.altText: A conflict played out in shadows.

props.synopsis: New data, released to coincide with the 16 Days of Activism against Gender-Based Violence, shows more people are seeking support when at imminent risk across central Victoria.

title.children: Service warns more people are seeking help when facing imminent risk

image.altText: A woman stands outside a cafe

props.synopsis: While Porepunkah residents are trying to move on from the tragic deaths of two police officers, there is one person they are eager to forget.

title.children: As Porepunkah tries to move on, one name remains too painful to hear

image.altText: Marilyn Warren, who has short brown hair, poses for a photo wearing a cream blazer

props.synopsis: Marilyn Warren made history when she was appointed chief justice of the Supreme Court of Victoria, though she has never thought of herself as a trailblazer.

title.children: She was a trailblazer for women in law. Her gender was, at times, a burden

image.altText: A woman sits smiling on top of a giant plush bunny lying on its back, surrounded by bright walls and pink flowery carpet

props.synopsis: Whether it's enormous puppets, interactive bunny installations or handmade ceramics, these artists are embracing joy, whimsy and silliness to help people connect to their inner child.

title.children: Want to connect with your inner child? These artists can show you how

image.altText: Caleb sitting on the beach digging a hole in the sand smiling.

props.synopsis: An 84-year-old woman is facing charges including fail to render assistance following the fatal collision west of Geelong in March.

title.children: Elderly woman charged over alleged hit-run crash that killed 6yo boy

image.altText: A woman taking a selfie with a man and three young children, whose faces have been blurred.

props.synopsis: The family's alternative lifestyle came under scrutiny after the British-Australian couple and their three children were hospitalised last year with mushroom poisoning.

title.children: Children removed from Australian mum living off-grid in Italian forest

image.altText: Cbus super logo on a glass window

props.synopsis: Superannuation giant Cbus will pay a $23.5 million fine after admitting it breached the law over major delays in its handling of insurance claims.

title.children: 'Promise to do better': Super giant Cbus ordered to pay $23.5m fine

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair in a pink shirt and black skirt stands with her arm around a man in a blue shirt in a wheelchair.

props.synopsis: Stunt pilot Glenn Collins says he is excited but daunted as he faces "the biggest rehab of my life — going home".

title.children: Avalon Airshow stunt pilot returns home eight months after crash

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a firefighter's uniform stands with his arms folded in what appears to be a fire station locker room.

props.synopsis: The ABC can reveal that in 2023 the Victorian government blocked Fire Rescue Victoria from pursuing legal action against PFAS manufacturer 3M.

title.children: Fire service blocked from pursuing US giant over 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: A pregnant stomach in focus with a midwife in the background at a desk

props.synopsis: A free "gold standard" antenatal care program is proving hugely popular and successful, but women are scrambling to get access.

title.children: Thousands of women missing out on 'gold standard' antenatal care

image.altText: Ash Riddell pumps her fists as she celebrates an AFLW goal for North Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Overlooked in multiple drafts before making her debut in 2019, North Melbourne's Ash Riddell is now the best player in the league.

title.children: How Riddell's rise to become AFLW's best mirrors Kangaroos' dominance
